alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Pickaway (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 5:31PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF FRANKLIN AND NORTH CENTRAL PICKAWAY COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 530 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Grove City, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Westerville, Reynoldsburg, Grove City, Upper Arlington, Gahanna, Worthington, Bexley, Canal Winchester, Groveport, Minerva Park, Ohio State University, Easton, Whitehall, New Albany, Grandview Heights, Obetz, Commercial Point, Urbancrest and Valleyview. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 93 and 110. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 92 and 120. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
